intro: Clidemia staphidioides, commonly known as the Hawaiian staphidioidean, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found growing in moist, shaded areas. It plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for native insects. However, it is considered an invasive species in some regions outside its native habitat.
